article.title: Hello, I'm Lucas
article.paragraph1: My name is Lucas, junior web developer passionate about web and mobile development. Currently a student at EFREI (class of 2023), I had the opportunity to train in modern technologies and agile methods, allowing me to develop efficient and innovative applications.

ul.title: Technical skills
ul.paragraph: I also continue to expand my skills to stay up to date with the latest industry trends.

article.paragraph2: I am actively looking for an internship or work-study program as a junior web developer. Motivated, curious and rigorous, I am ready to take on new challenges, learn new technologies, and fully invest in a team.
article.paragraph3: Outside of development, I have a great passion for music, video games, reading, traveling, and cooking. These passions fuel my creativity and my ability to adapt to different environments.
article.paragraph5: I am available for an interview or to discuss if you have questions, suggestions or opportunities to offer me.

materialPage.title: Here is my material to work with

ul.title: Performance
ul.li3: Graphics card: Integrated into the processor

article2.p: My desktop PC was assembled by me, it is a PC with large capacities and a Dual boot

article3.p: In addition to PCs I have a headset and an Android phone

technologiesPage.title: Here are the technologies I worked with

HTML.description: HTML is the standard language used to structure and display content on web pages. It allows you to define the structure of a page using tags, such as <p> for paragraphs, <a> for links, and <div> for containers.
HTML.principale: Creating the structure of web pages.

CSS.description: CSS is a styling language used to control the appearance of HTML documents. It defines colors, fonts, spacing, layouts, and other visual elements.
CSS.principale: Styling and layout of web pages.

JavaScript.description: JavaScript is a dynamic and interpreted programming language that allows you to add interactive features to web pages, such as animations, dynamic forms, or content updates without reloading the page.
JavaScript.principale: Interactivity and dynamism of web pages.

Node.js.description: Node.js is a server-side JavaScript platform that allows you to run JavaScript code outside a browser. It is designed for fast, scalable network applications with its non-blocking, event-driven architecture.
Node.js.principale: Building server-side and real-time applications (like chats or APIs).

PHP.description: PHP is a server-side scripting language designed for web development. It is used to create dynamic web pages by generating content based on data from a database or other sources.
PHP.principale: Building dynamic websites and managing servers.

Symfony.description: Symfony is a powerful and flexible PHP framework that helps build robust web applications. It follows an MVC (Model-View-Controller) architecture and provides reusable tools to speed up development.
Symfony.principale: Developing structured and maintainable web applications.

MySQL.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system. It uses SQL language to manipulate and manage data stored in tables.

PostgreSQL.description: PostgreSQL is an advanced open-source relational database management system known for its robustness, extensibility, and support for advanced features like custom data types.

Git.description: Git is a distributed version control system that allows developers to track changes to source code, collaborate effectively, and manage multiple versions of a project.
Git.principale: Version control and collaboration in development projects.

GitHub.description: GitHub is a Git-based platform for storing, sharing, and collaborating on development projects. It offers tools like pull requests, issues, and workflows for project management.
GitHub.principale: Hosting and collaboration on source code projects.

projectsPage.title: Here are some of my projects

1.title: Portfolio
1.description: My personal portfolio to showcase my skills, background, and projects. It is built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and hosted on GitHub Pages.

2.title: Alpine WFHelper
2.description: A tool developed for workflow automation and management on Alpine. The project explores the integration of custom scripts to simplify processes.

3.title: Server Web
3.description: Development of a simple web server, capable of hosting and serving static or dynamic content. Ideal for exploring the basics of web servers.

4.title: Helldiver's 2 Challenge
4.description: Participation in a web challenge as part of the EFREI curriculum, showcasing front-end development skills and problem-solving.

5.title: THREE.js Pong Project
5.description: An implementation of the classic Pong game using THREE.js, showcasing 3D graphics and immersive game logic.

6.title: Unix Project
6.description: A project focused on development in a Unix environment, using custom scripts to solve problems or automate tasks.
